name: RÉTI OPENING
idea: The most flexible opening! With 1.Nf3 and 2.g3 or 2.c4, White delays committing to a pawn structure. The Réti can transpose into the English, Catalan, King's Indian Attack, or stay independent. The fianchettoed Bg2 controls the long diagonal. White's plan: develop harmoniously, then decide on d4 or e4 based on Black's setup. Perfect for players who like to outplay opponents positionally!
errors_white: Playing without a clear plan: flexibility is good but you need a goal
Pushing d4 and c4 too early: can transpose into uncomfortable lines
Neglecting the center: at some point d4 or e4 must come
errors_black: Being too passive: ...d5 and ...c5 must fight for the center
Ignoring the Bg2: this Bishop controls the long diagonal
Copying White's setup: Black must find independent play
development: Always first - controls e5 and d4, flexible
Attacks d5 - it's the heart of the Réti
g3 then Bg2 - the fianchetto controls the long diagonal
d3 (solid) or d4 (transpose) depending on plan
Nc3 or Nbd2 depending on chosen structure
Kingside castle after g3/Bg2 - very safe position

traps.name: Center Trap
traps.desc: After 2.c4, if Black plays ...d4?! 3.e3! dxe3 4.fxe3 and White has a strong center or if ...d4 3.b4! reversed Blumenfeld Gambit with initiative. AVOID (Black): Play ...e6, ...c6 or ...dxc4.

traps.name: Transposition Trap
traps.desc: After ...e6 3.g3, we're close to the Catalan! If Black doesn't know it, they can suffer from the Bg2 targeting d5. AVOID (Black): Know the Catalan or play ...c6 (Slav structure).

traps.name: Gambit Trap
traps.desc: If ...dxc4 2...d4?! White has 3.e3! and the d4 pawn falls or creates weaknesses. Black's structure is compromised. AVOID (Black): After ...dxc4, play ...e6 or ...c6, not ...d4.

variants.name: Réti Accepted
variants.uci: g1f3 d7d5 c2c4 d5c4 e2e3 c7c5 f1c4 b8c6 e1g1 g8f6
variants.white_plan: Recover the pawn and develop. Nc3, d4 and Queen's Gambit or English type position with good play.
variants.black_plan: ...c5 center is solid. ...e6, ...Be7, ...0-0 then ...a6/...b5 or ...Qc7 to equalize.

variants.name: Réti with Bg2
variants.uci: g1f3 d7d5 c2c4 e7e6 g2g3 g8f6 f1g2 f8e7 e1g1 e8g8 b2b3
variants.white_plan: Double fianchetto possible! Bb2, d3, Nbd2 and control from afar. cxd5 then e4 at the right moment.
variants.black_plan: Solid position. ...c5 or ...c6 to reinforce d5. ...Nc6/...Nbd7, ...b6/...Bb7 to contest the diagonal.

variants.name: Catalan Transposition
variants.uci: g1f3 d7d5 c2c4 e7e6 g2g3 g8f6 f1g2 d5c4 d1a4 b8d7 a4c4
variants.white_plan: We transpose into the Open Catalan! Same plans: Qc2, 0-0, d4, Nc3 with positional pressure.
variants.black_plan: Catalan plans: ...a6, ...b5 or ...c5 to free up. ...Bb7, ...Be7, ...0-0 with defensible position.
